replies.msg:
Liverpool did hold talks with David Alaba’s camp last year as they worked on a deal for Thiago. But while the defender’s skillset is appreciated by Liverpool, he is understood to be too small and not strong enough aerially for their requirements at CB. #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

Any attraction for Alaba as well disappeared when Kostas Tsimikas was brought in. Liverpool’s thinking was that the appeal for signing a player of his age and salary, who didn’t quite fit their CB profile, was that he could operate at left fullback too. #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

When Liverpool do buy a centre-back, it will be their intention that the player ultimately replaces Joel Matip. There are no designs on recruiting around the age of 30 for the position and that a move for Alaba is “a hard no.” #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

Liverpool did hold talks with David Alaba’s camp last year as they worked on a deal for Thiago. But while the defender’s skillset is appreciated by Liverpool, he is understood to be too small and not strong enough aerially for their requirements at CB. #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

Any attraction for Alaba as well disappeared when Kostas Tsimikas was brought in. Liverpool’s thinking was that the appeal for signing a player of his age and salary, who didn’t quite fit their CB profile, was that he could operate at left fullback too. #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

When Liverpool do buy a centre-back, it will be their intention that the player ultimately replaces Joel Matip. There are no designs on recruiting around the age of 30 for the position and that a move for Alaba is “a hard no.” #awlfc [@MelissaReddy_]

.@DuncanCastles: "Brighton's Yves Bissouma is being thought of as an option to replace Gini Wijnaldum if he leaves at the end of the season. Jurgen Klopp has done some work to ask questions about Bissouma to people who know him well." #awlfc [transfer window podcast]

Joel Matip is running out of time to prove his fitness ahead of Sunday’s table-topping clash with Manchester United. It is understood the Liverpool centre half has progressed to training in specially-prepared sessions with the physios. #awlfc [@MaddockMirror]

Matip is back running and working with a ball on grass, but he has yet to train with the first-team squad, and Klopp would need to see him train for two sessions with his team-mates, and come through with no reaction, to be ready. #awlfc [@MaddockMirror]

That leaves him little time to prove his fitness, and with games coming thick and fast after the United game - with an intense period where they will effectively play every three days - then Klopp may decide not to risk his key central defender. #awlfc [@MaddockMirror]
